headline: Disney, Fox, Warner Bros. Discovery call off Venu Sports plans
summary: Disney-owned (DIS) ESPN, Fox (FOX, FOXA), and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) are in focus after the media companies abandoned plans for their joint sports streaming service, Venu Sports. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Alexandra Canal sits down with Catalysts Co-Hosts Seana Smith and Madison Mills to break down the news, detailing the joint statement released from the media giants. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Venu Sports — the proposed sports streaming venture between ESPN, Fox, and Warner Bros. — is no more
summary: Disney's ESPN, Warner Bros. Discovery, and Fox have canceled plans to launch their joint sports streaming service.

headline: Disney, WBD, Fox pull plug on Venu Sports streaming service before launch
summary: Venu Sports, the joint streaming service from Warner Bros. Discovery, Fox Corp., and Disney, has been discontinued before its launch, the trio announced in a surprise move Friday morning.

headline: Fox Must Face Smartmatic’s Defamation Lawsuit, Appeals Court Rules
summary: A New York state appeals court rejected  Fox  bid to throw out a defamation lawsuit by Smartmatic over false claims that the voting technology company helped rig the 2020 presidential election.  Smartmatic alleges that Fox Corp., Fox News and some of its hosts amplified misinformation that hurt its business and caused reputational harm.  The voting technology business is seeking billions in damages.
